column4: I have a question (sorry for repost): who do I have to contact about the package version in hoary ?
which package ?
http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=9496
they get in automatically if sid is synced again.....
hoary regulary syncs with sid
but some package are in Hoary before sid...
yep....because they are made by ubuntu devs.... they then get synced back
that would be better than hoary provides also its own packages (php5) instead of waiting them in SID
But where can I ask for suggestions of package ? (MySQL 4.1.8 by default, or the choice between OOo 1.1.4 & 1.9.65 (it's 'only' 1.1.3 in hoary))
either ubuntu-users or ubuntu-devel
there will be 2.0 if hoary goes public i think
there is, look for hoary goals
: that's not really the same
hoary will have all package versions that are in sid if hoary freezes....
warty ?
: yes, but for the packages that are not in sid or not up-to-date in sid ?
warty doesnt recieve updates despite security stuff
not warty, i'm talking about the devel-hoary I use everyday (I don't want to wait until march 2005 ;) )
as i said it gets synced regulary.... dont ask me for the timeframe
: but it's wired... some new packages are up-to-date, and some older than 10 days in SID are not in horay... Seems like a "selected-sync"
maybe, probably it are pkgs where someone just works on
wouldnt be nice to overwrite his work with a sid version....
